title: Unit 1: Friends and Family - Reading Lesson Student Handout
description: Comprehensive student materials for a 120-minute beginner-level reading lesson focusing on understanding texts about people and families, with language focus on present tense of 'be', be + adjective structures, and family vocabulary.

PART B: WHILE-READING ACTIVITIES (50 minutes)

THE READING TEXT: My Friends and Family

Hello! My name is Maria.

Hello! My name is Maria. I'm 15 years old. I'm from Italy. I'm a student. I live in Rome with my family. My family is big and very nice.

This is my mother. Her name is Anna. She is 42 years old. She is very kind and friendly. She is a teacher. My father's name is Paolo. He is 45 years old. He is tall and funny. He is a doctor. My parents are from Rome. They are very happy.

I have two brothers and one sister. My sister's name is Sofia. She is 18 years old. She is a university student. Sofia is tall and very beautiful. She is my best friend. My brothers are young. Their names are Marco and Luca. Marco is 12 years old and Luca is 8 years old. They are very funny and active. Marco is good at football. Luca is good at music.

My grandmother lives with us. Her name is Rosa. She is 68 years old. She is very kind. Grandmother Rosa makes delicious food. She is from Sicily. My grandfather is not with us now, but I have good memories of him.

Hi! I'm John.

Hi! I'm John. I'm 16 years old. I'm from England. I'm from London. I'm a student at Park Secondary School. My family is small, but we are close.

My mother is Laura. She is 44 years old. She is short and very nice. She is a nurse at City Hospital. She is very busy, but she is always kind. My father is David. He is 46 years old. He is tall and quiet. He is an engineer. My parents are very hard-working.

I have one sister. Her name is Emma. She is 13 years old. Emma is my little sister. She is short and very clever. She is good at mathematics and science. Emma is also very funny. We are good friends.

I have a best friend. His name is Tom. Tom is from Ireland. He is 16 years old, the same age as me. We are in the same class at school. Tom is very friendly and outgoing. He is good at sports. We play football together every weekend. Tom is like a brother to me.

I also have a good friend from Italy. Her name is Maria! We are penfriends. We write emails every week. Maria is very nice and interesting. She tells me about her big family in Italy. I hope to visit Maria in Rome one day. Friends are very important to me.

PART C: POST-READING AND LANGUAGE FOCUS (43 minutes)

Activity 1: Understanding the Language - Meaning (15 minutes)

Let's understand WHEN and WHY we use these forms.

Look at these sentences from the text and answer the questions:

Sentence from TextQuestions - Discuss with Partner
"My name is Maria."
"I'm 15 years old."		What is Maria doing?
☐ Saying her name and age
☐ Describing an action
☐ Talking about the future
"She is very kind."
"He is tall and funny."		What are these sentences doing?
☐ Describing what people look like or their personality
☐ Saying where people are
☐ Talking about actions
"This is my mother."
"Tom is my best friend."		What is the writer doing?
☐ Introducing people and showing relationships
☐ Asking questions
☐ Giving directions

Summary: When do we use AM / IS / ARE?

We use the verb BE (am/is/are) to:

  1. Say our name, age, job, nationality
    Example: I'm Maria. I'm 15 years old. I'm a student. I'm from Italy.
  2. Describe people (say what they are like)
    Example: She is kind. He is tall. They are funny.
  3. Introduce people and show relationships
    Example: This is my mother. Tom is my best friend.
